question: Which instrument used to measure Electric Resistance?
hints: A galvanometer is used for detecting and indicating an electric current
A spectrometer is used to separate and measure spectral components of a physical phenomenon
An electrometer is used for measuring electric charge or electrical potential difference
aboutAnswer: An Ohmmeter is an electrical instrument that measures electrical resistance, the opposition to an electric current. Micro-ohmmeters (microhmmeter or microohmmeter) make low resistance measurements. Megohmmeters (also a trademarked device Megger) measure large values of resistance. he unit of measurement for resistance is ohms (Ω).
